Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: 13inky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2009, very nicely decorated, and very quiet. In the area of nice little cafes and restaurants too, not far from St. Mark's square, if I remember correctly. It seemed a little shady how we had to call someone, who'd then come and let us in though, and we never seemed to see anyone at reception. Breakfast was also just some pre-packeaged crossiants and orange juice..had to stop at cafes to get something decent. But overall, quite luxurious and restful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Castello”
Reviews.Author: Nautikus
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, even though we struggled to find the place. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was nicely furnished and reasonably clean. Cons: the lower bit of the shower curtain was orange with mould. Breakfast was very average, even to Italian standards. Expensive (I guess you're paying mainly for the location)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny hotel, no hotel services”
Reviews.Author: bigelskis
Reviews.Content: We got there by following directions we printed out from the hotel site, from the San Zacceria water taxi stop. Make sure you print out their directions and follow them explicitely, or you will never find this tiny (6 rooms) hotel, which is located in a back alley. When we got to the hotel the door was locked and no one was in the lobby (it was the middle of the afternoon). There were two buzzers by the door. We had to keep ringing them for about 10 minutes until someone finally answered and buzzed us in. The key was on the front desk and our room was across from reception. The free Internet didn't work and the room phone only rang in reception, where no one was. So I went outside, buzzed again and was told the Internet password, which didn't help. After going back and forth a few times it was clear that Internet wasn't working. Two days later the owner finally showed up, reset the router and now we had Internet. Not great service in my book. The room itself was pretty nice and a comfortable size, the free breakfast was skimpy and only included a few rolls, juice and coffee, nothing else. The location was the best part, near San Marco and boats to everywhere. If you are totally self sufficient and don't require reliable internet service or standard hotel services (no one there to help with directions, bookings, restaurant recommendations, check-in, wake up calls, etc) then this a good budget choice. If you want a hotel with services look elsewhere. If I were to go back to Venice I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded charming quiet”
Reviews.Author: Chambesy
Reviews.Content: The Locanda Ca' Valeri is close to Piazza San Marco and to the San Zacceria boat stop. Yet it is just distant enough to give you the feeling that Venice is yours and that you're not part of the tourist masses. The shops and restaurant in the area are different from those closer to the main tourist attractions. Ca' Valeri is also very quiet! Just around the corner of the tiny ally you'll find a lovely square with a good restaurant and the perfect local bar for your morning coffee with brioche. (Remember that in Italy prices are different for consumptions standing at the bar and sitting down at a table.) Service in the Locanda is limited. You'll find your key waiting for you on the counter with a note with your room number. My room was clean, decoration charming, antique, Murano glass lamps (see website http://www.locandacavaleri.com/). Bath room modern, elegant. Air conditioning low noise and good. The Jacuzzi wasn't working, neither was the TV. I didn't really mind. It was wonderful to lie in the large Jacuzzi tub even without the hydro-massage and a few days without television is always a relief. Davide the manager/owner promised he would have both repaired the day of my departure... Do check if he did! My colleague and I had breakfast in the bar around the corner on our way to work. When I needed to call a restaurant one evening I found the phone book in the office at the entrance and called myself. I would recommend this small, quiet, charming place to anyone who doesn't need to be looked after. If you want more service another hotel might be more convenient for you. I want to clarify that service wasn't bad. The people were in fact very friendly! But they were there only part of the time (never in the evenings). I loved the simple style and really enjoyed my stay. I'll go back the next time I go to Venice. The price for the room seemed reasonable 180 euro/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JosieQ11
Reviews.Content: Hotel within walking distance of major sites but far enough away to escape the crowds. We stayed in a triple room which was spacious, overlooked great courtyard but beds were too firm. Most of the staff goes out of there way to help it's guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mkl333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Locanda Ca' Valeri for two nights and wish it had been more. The hotel was easy to find following the directions on the website. We were amazed when we walked in the door to our room. We were expecting a very basic budget style room for what we had paid and were shocked at how nice the room was and how big and updated the bathroom was. This was by far the best value that we found during our two week trip! I doubt that you will find a better value in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: macca1191
Reviews.Content: Like most small hotels in Venice this one is difficult to find but a friendly local took pity on us. Strangely we were then confronted with a locked entrance door to the hotel and the owner then conversing with us via an intercom. We were then let in remotely and picked up our keys which were on the reception desk and found our room again via the intercom instructions Lovely room with fabric wall coverings and a stunning bathroom very quiet and close to all the normal tourist attractions. We met the friendly owner the following morning when he delivered continental breakfast to the room as he explained that the normal area for breakfast was in a small courtyard outside but it was too cold to use. We enjoyed our 2 nights at the hotel and would certainly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: vdelbarco
Reviews.Content: everything perfect. Perhaps a bit hard to find, but finallly the location was perfect instead at first time looks a bit far from city centre. We choosed a standard room but one of the suites was empty form that they so they assigned us the suite at the roof for the same price. The breakfast is a bit light. Is very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice- if you can find it”
Reviews.Author: dwardy
Reviews.Content: Venice does not have many street signs, so it took us a while to find the address. The room was nice and the front desk staff (when he was there) was helpful. Location was great- in the center of everything. Our room happened to be somewhat below street level, which was a surprise, making it dark for lack of windows.

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing”
Reviews.Author: traveler7909
Reviews.Content: After reading some reports i decided to go there with my boyfriend and i would go again for sure! They are very nice and kind, with a really worm welcome and they make you feel like home. Everything really clean and nice, our room had a whirlpool inside and it was absolutely amazing. And we absolutely enjoyed it after the whole day walking! They brought us breakfast everyday to our room, all we asked, fruit, and fresh backed croissants (still worm when they broth them!!) each sort of coffee we orderedâ€¦. Just great!! Just tell them what you want to have and when and they bring it to you without any extra cost! The place itâ€™s a bit difficult to find first time, but they offer to pick you up for free if you want. It is really 5 min walking to St. Marcoâ€™s squareâ€¦just worth it!! Really good price, excellent service, and amazing people working in there. They also gave us great tips where to eat and what to do! Iâ€™m sure next time Iâ€™m going to Venice I will stay there again. I will post some pictures as soon as I can. But you wonâ€™t fail if you go there! Donâ€™t let you down with the outside impressionâ€¦ inside is like a little palace! Thank you for the great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: juanita58
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room #1 ,the only room on the main floor and right across from the reception desk. There was no noise at all as there is a double door separating the room from the lobby. We paid 297 euros for 4 nights with a special buy 3 nights and get the 4th free. The room was very clean with two twin beds pushed together and a tacky yet cool murano glass chandelier hanging over the bed. There were two high windows that did not let in alot of light because of being on the lower floor and the buildings are so close together. But that did not matter, it was great for sleeping. The decor was pretty typical Italian style. The bathroom was fairly small and the toilet in an odd spot so you had to duck your knees under the sink but we managed fine. Breakfast is included with the room rate. Basically it is just packaged pastry, cookies and biscuits along with coffee, tea, cappucino and juice boxes. There is a kettle to boil water in the room. We bought some yogurt and fruit to go with it and it was all we needed to get us started and out into Venice for the real food! The room was cleaned daily, there was a mini fridge and air conditioning (great during the heat wave) but no safe.The couple things that I would have liked to be different were that the front desk person did not speak English at all when we arrived and after that we rarely saw anyone at the front desk. Apparently it is only manned during the day but even then we never saw anyone to ask questions and we ended up paying our bill in advance as we were worried that when the time came to leave there would be no one around. We left a note on the desk to get their attention. The key to the front door and our room was on a gigantic metal thing and it was so heavy we finally took the keys off and left it in the room. The best thing about it was the location. Just far enough from the madding crowds but only 10 minutes max walk to San Marco. Lots of good little restaurants close by as well as the Arsenale vaporetto. The hotel's directions were just fine and we found it without much problem, though keep in mind it is on a little dead end street and you must check for the hotel sign on the wall next to the iron grill door. If you want a clean, comfy bed to sleep in and a good location and don't want to pay alot then this could be the place for you. I would stay here again when on a budget conscious holiday. FYI: there did not appear to be an elevator. Their guest book had good reviews written in though a few comments about the hot water running out. Too many showering at the same time? We did experience that once over 4 days. Just waited a bit and tried again and it was fine.

HotelInfo.Name: BHR Boutique Hotel Locanda Ca'Valeri
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 3845, 30122 Venice, Italy
